company.name: WithAI Research
company.description: YC W26 startup building LLMs for AI-native hedge funds

experiences.summary: Building the core platform and infrastructure for large language models designed specifically for AI-native hedge funds. Developing systems that enable sophisticated financial analysis, market trend identification, and intelligent trading strategies through advanced language models.
responsibilities: Architecting and implementing core LLM infrastructure for financial applications
Developing production ML systems for real-time market analysis
Building APIs and services for LLM-powered financial tools
Designing data pipelines for training and fine-tuning financial models
Implementing reliability and performance monitoring for production systems
Collaborating on research direction and model capabilities
achievements: Built foundational infrastructure for AI-native hedge fund platform from scratch
Developed LLM integration systems for financial data analysis
Implemented production-ready services handling real-time financial data
challenges: Building reliable LLM systems for high-stakes financial decision-making
Ensuring model outputs are accurate, consistent, and explainable
Designing systems that handle real-time financial data at scale
Balancing model capability with latency and cost requirements
learnings: Production LLM engineering requires careful attention to reliability, consistency, and failure modes
Financial applications demand exceptionally high accuracy and explainability
Importance of robust data pipelines and validation for ML systems
Building 0-to-1 products requires balancing speed with technical rigor
Working at the intersection of AI and finance offers unique technical challenges
experiences.motivation: Excited by the opportunity to work at the frontier of AI applications in finance. Interested in building systems that leverage LLMs for complex analytical tasks that traditionally required human expertise. The challenge of making AI reliable enough for high-stakes financial decisions is compelling.
experiences.impact: Contributing to the next generation of AI-powered financial analysis tools. Helping build infrastructure that could transform how hedge funds operate and make decisions.
experiences.context: Joined as founding engineer during company formation, taking on full-stack responsibility for core platform development. Work involves both cutting-edge ML research and production engineering.

company.name: Princeton High Meadows Environmental Institute (HMEI)
company.description: Leading environmental research institute focused on climate science, environmental policy, and sustainability

experiences.summary: Conducted computational research on solar radiation management (SRM) strategies as potential climate intervention approaches. Investigated the effectiveness of different stratospheric aerosol types for global cooling, with focus on comparing black carbon and sulfate aerosols.
experiences.researchFocus: Solar Radiation Management and Climate Engineering
experiences.researchQuestion: How do different types of stratospheric aerosols compare in their effectiveness for global cooling through solar radiation management?
methodology: Computational climate modeling using Python-based simulation tools
Comparative analysis of black carbon vs. sulfate aerosol effectiveness
Quantitative evaluation of cooling potential, radiative forcing, and climate impacts
Data visualization and statistical analysis of simulation outputs
Literature review of existing SRM research and methodologies

keyFindings.finding: Black carbon aerosols in the stratosphere are approximately 10x more effective at cooling than traditional reflective sulfate aerosols
keyFindings.significance: Challenges conventional assumptions in solar radiation management research
keyFindings.implications: Suggests alternative approaches to climate intervention may be more cost-effective and require lower aerosol mass
keyFindings.caveat: Black carbon aerosols also have different side effects and risks that must be evaluated

achievements: Discovered order-of-magnitude improvement in cooling effectiveness
Presented research findings to faculty and peers
Contributed to understanding of stratospheric aerosol behavior
Published research presentation documenting methodology and findings
challenges: Learning complex climate modeling tools and methodologies
Understanding the physics of stratospheric aerosols and radiative transfer
Communicating technical findings to diverse audiences
learnings: Climate systems are extraordinarily complex with many interacting factors
Computational modeling requires careful validation and sensitivity analysis
Research findings often challenge existing assumptions
Importance of clear communication in scientific work
Climate intervention is technically possible but requires careful evaluation of trade-offs
experiences.motivation: Interested in understanding potential technological approaches to addressing climate change. Drawn to the interdisciplinary nature of climate science combining physics, data science, and policy implications. Wanted to contribute to research on climate intervention strategies.
experiences.impact: Research contributes to scientific understanding of solar radiation management options. Findings suggest alternative aerosol types may be more effective than currently proposed approaches, potentially influencing future climate intervention research directions.
experiences.context: This research was conducted as part of Princeton's HMEI program, which brings together researchers from multiple disciplines to address environmental challenges. The work combined computational skills with climate science to explore potential technological interventions for global warming.

careerProgression.narrative: Skyler's career path reflects a pattern of seeking high-impact opportunities at the intersection of multiple domains. From climate research at Princeton HMEI (combining data science with climate physics) to founding engineer at an AI-focused fintech startup (combining LLMs with financial systems), he consistently pursues roles that require both technical depth and interdisciplinary thinking. His progression shows increasing responsibility and scope, from research assistant to founding engineer, while maintaining focus on building systems that address meaningful problems.
themes: Building at the intersection of multiple domains
Applying AI/ML to complex real-world problems
Combining research depth with practical engineering
Seeking high-impact opportunities in emerging fields
Learning through building and shipping products

strengths: Full-stack capability from ML research to production deployment
Comfortable with ambiguity and 0-to-1 product development
Strong systems thinking and architectural design
Ability to learn quickly across diverse domains
Balance of theoretical understanding and practical implementation
workStyle.approach: Bias toward action and building. Prefers learning by doing rather than extended planning. Comfortable with technical depth but also pragmatic about shipping and iterating. Values clear communication and documentation.
interests: Novel applications of AI and ML
Building tools that empower human decision-making
